LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerDesc:
One or more of your robots are not controlled. Connect your robots to a roboticist with sufficient bandwidth to control them.

If left uncontrolled for more than a day, a robot could go feral. When this happens they will join {0} and become hostile to you. If one robot goes feral, it will bring other nearby robots with it.

Feral robots cannot be resurrected at a gestator when killed.
LanguageData.AlertMechLacksOverseerMayGoFeral: The following robots are uncontrolled and could go feral at any moment
LanguageData.AlertRechargerFullDesc: Some robo-recharger(s) are storing their maximum number of toxic wastepacks. Robots can't use these chargers until the toxic wastepacks are hauled away.\n\nSelect a colonist and right-click a recharger to unload it.
LanguageData.AlertNeedMechChargersDesc:
You don't have robo-rechargers for all your robots. If a robot runs out of energy, it will fall into a dormant self-charging state and will recharge very slowly.

Build more of the following robot-chargers:
{0}

Note: Only light robots can use regular robo-rechargers. Medium or heavier robots require large robo-rechargers.
LanguageData.AlertNeedMechChargerBasicMechtech: Research basic robotech or higher to build robo-rechargers.
LanguageData.AlertMechMissingBodyPartDesc: One or more of your robots are missing a body part. A roboticist can repair lost parts.\n\nThe robots with lost body parts are
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDescPrefix: These robots are damaged and need repair
LanguageData.AlertMechNeedsRepairDesc: Order a roboticist to repair them, or select the robot and turn on auto-repair. Repairing a robot requires energy. If a robots's energy is so low it can't move, someone must carry it to a recharger.
LanguageData.AlertBossgroupIncomingDesc: Signaled by your roboticist, a hostile {0} is approaching with its combat escort. Be prepared, this won't be an easy fight. The hostile robots will arrive in a few hours or days.
